summary: D. J. Brennan, Jr. is mentioned in four documents related to CIA and FBI activities. One memo is addressed to him from S.J. Papich regarding a CIA operation to create a fake U.S.-based communist organization. He is also mentioned in connection to CIA activities, including potential funding of the National Council of Churches. Additionally, he is mentioned in a memo discussing the handling of sensitive information received from the CIA, particularly concerning "Bureau Informant 100" (James Angleton) and SCOPE material (Israeli intelligence activities). Finally, he is mentioned in a document involving coordination between the CIA and FBI regarding the release of JFK assassination-related documents.
significance: D. J. Brennan, Jr.'s significance in the JFK context appears to be related to his involvement in coordination between the CIA and FBI regarding the release of JFK assassination-related documents. The documents suggest he was involved in handling sensitive information and coordinating with other agencies.
